reviews.title: In the middle of it all
reviews.text: The wonderful old town consists a short (1,000 feet?) main street that runs into a square with the large Duomo and City Hall. This rests atop a large hill off from which run many small streets. The Locanda is on that main street so you cannot have a better location. The hotel is beautifully done, intimate and comfortable with medium sized rooms and excellent bathrooms tastefully executed. Ask for one with views of the main street. The hotel is not formal or stuffy which is a plus in a small town like the old section of Perugia. Breakfast is fine and the staff are helpful.
The hotel is in a great location, and very charming. The accommodations are good, but not luxurious.
reviews.title: Great Location
The perfect spot
reviews.text: This was the perfect place to stay for our 5 day sojourn in Perugia, right on pedestrian-only Corso Vannucci, within close walking distance of the escalators to the bus terminal as well as a number of very satisfying restaurants. Both the room and bathroom were very spacious and clean and the breakfast was abundant. On a minor point, front desk staff did not exude the warm friendliness we are used to encountering in Italian hotels and can best be described as polite and businesslike. This hotel met all our expectations for a 4 star establishment and we would definitely return.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Location, location, location! That's the main attraction to Locanda Della Posta. You are right in the old city, steps away from all the action, including the churches and great restaurants of Perugia. We loved walking outside to all this. The hotel itself was good but not great. I have a problem with Trip Advisor in that there is no way you can give a hotel like this 5 circles as compared to the best luxury hotels of Perugia. This is a faded hotel that isn't posh and is a bit rough around the edges. Actually, the only reason I gave it 4 circles and not three circles is for its great location. Otherwise, I would have opted for three.
So yes, I'd recommend it, but don't listen to the other breathless reviewers when they say it's five circles -- for five circles you should expect an amazing hotel -- this is only "good."
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Perugia is a gem
Perugia is Great!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Locanda Della Posta for six nights in June/July, 2004. The hotel could not have been better. The room, the staff, the wonderful breakfast and the location were all excellant. The hotel is on Corso Vannucci close to all the shops, pubs and Gelato that anyone would want. The taxi stand and bus stop is about 1/2 block away so it was convenient to trips into the newer (lower) part of town.
